revised_title: The Process of Extracting Pitch, Tar, Rosin, and Turpentine in Marseilles
tldr: The author describes the process of extracting pitch, tar, rosin, and turpentine from pine trees near Marseilles. The process involves cutting the bark of pine trees to allow sap to flow, collecting the sap, and then distilling it to separate turpentine, rosin, and other products. The remaining tree chips are burned to produce tar and pitch.
